biotools.summary: Passive acoustic sensing has emerged as a powerful tool for quantifying anthropogenic impacts on biodiversity, especially for echolocating bat species. This tool helps better assess bat population trends accurately and allow the detection and classification of bat calls in large collections of audio recordings.
